comments:
I20060428-0010

- have the following setup:

workspace/
   org.user/                 [has 'library.jar' on its classpath]
       class org.user.X      [references library.jar, extends Serializable]
   org.library/              [closed]
       lib/library.jar       [<- does exist on file system]

- close org.library  (-> build path error in org.user)
- run clean up on org.user, select the "serial version" clean up option

-> clean up fails, log:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ltk.ui.refactoring 4 10000 2006-04-28 17:11:35.497
!MESSAGE Internal Error
!STACK 0
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at org.eclipse.ltk.internal.ui.refactoring.WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.run(WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.java:91)

Caused by: org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: The archive: /org.library/lib/library.jar which is referenced by the classpath, does not exist.

What happens if you add a main method and try to run the type? If that also fails, then this is general launching problem .

(In reply to comment #1)
> What happens if you add a main method and try to run the type? If that also
> fails, then this is general launching problem .

Yes, when running the project with the library project closed, a similar exception is logged.
Benno, we should fail gracefully if the launch failed. What's the story for other failures in CleanUp? Do we just abort with a fatal error status?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 140214 ***
